result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherry Lou Lonetree - Gray

records.addlTxt: Atty Hart received and waives reading of the Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Atty Hart enters not guilty plea, Court enters Not Guilty Plea.  Atty Hart suggests a TSC.  Matter reset.

9:42 AM Defendant Sherry Lou Lonetree - Gray appeared by telephone/video.  Attorney Taylor M Hart appeared by video for Sherry Lou Lonetree - Gray.  Attorney Emily Eklund in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hart advises DE is on phone by speaker due to no audio connection through Zoom.  DE is now connected through Zoom audio only.  Counsel do not object to DE proceeding with just audio and no video.  Atty Hart went over the waiver form with DE by telephone yesterday.  DE agrees to the waiver.  Atty Hart is satisfied with the waiver.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
from Atty Hart requesting zoom hearing

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:10 PM Defendant Sherry Lou Lonetree - Gray in court. Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Taylor Hart, 620 8th Avenue, Baraboo, WI (608) 355-2000 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month commencing August 1, 2022, directly to the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
Not to engage in any abusive conduct with Tia Gray to include kicking, biting, striking or restraining her.

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess appeared by video and intern Dan Moon in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherry Lou Lonetree - Gray appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Leonie Dolch appears by video with DE.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE does not qualify for PD appt.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Address is correct.  State requests $500 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Dolch responds - objects to cash and no contacts requested.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Court would accommodate a video prelim if it's arranged in advance.  $100.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to engage in any abusive conduct with Tia Gray to include kicking, biting, striking or restraining her.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
